page.title: 03A Chiltern Vineyard.
page.content: A three acre site at Old Luxter's Farm has been planted with grape vines. The site lies on a gentle slope facing S.E. and is well sheltered by woods, but open to the S.E. thus getting the benefit of the sun. Below it the land drops some 200 feet to the valley so it is a well drained site. The rows of vines run eastwards. Three types of grape are grown, and are planted alternately two rows of each type. One grape is a heavy cropper, another a rich fruity taste and the third is of a high quality. Modern stainless steel equipment has been installed in the old farm outbuildings and includes a small laboratory. The largest vat holds 4000 litres of wine.
